Standardized Testing

SAT

http://sat.collegeboard.com/home
Section # of Items Time
Critical Reading 3 sections 1 hr. 10 min.
Math 3 sections 1 hr. 10 min.
Writing 3 sections (1 essay) 1 hr.

Total Time: 3 hr. 45 min.

SAT II

http://sat.collegeboard.com/about-tests
Section # of Items Time
Literature ≈60 multiple choice 1 hr.
US History 90 multiple choice 1 hr.
World History 95 multiple choice 1 hr.
Math Level 1 50 multiple choice 1 hr.
Math Level 2 50 multiple choice 1 hr.
Biology/EM 80 multiple choice 1 hr.
Chemistry 85 multiple choice 1 hr.
Physics 75 multiple choice 1 hr.
Italian 80-85 multiple choice 1 hr.

ACT

http://actstudent.org/
Section # of Items Time
English 75 multiple choice 45 min.
Math 60 multiple choice 60 min.
Reading 40 multiple choice 35 min.
Science 40 multiple choice 35 min.
Writing (optional) 1 essay 30 mins.

Total Time w/ Writing: 3 hr. 25 min.
Total Time w/out Writing: 2 hr. 55 min.

PSAT

http://www.nationalmerit.org/entering.php
Section # of Items Time
Critical Reading 2 sections 50 min.
Math 2 sections 50 min.
Writing 1 sections 30 min.

Total Time: 3 hr. 45 min.

PLAN (ACT)

http://www.actstudent.org/plan/
Section # of Items Time
English 50 multiple choice 30 min.
Math 40 multiple choice 40 min.
Reading 25 multiple choice 20 min.
Science 30 multiple choice 25 min.

Total Time: 1 hr. 55 min.

JOHNS HOPKINS CTY

http://cty.jhu.edu/ts/grades78.html
Please use the SAT/ACT timetable format.

http://cty.jhu.edu/ts/newtestnew.html
The Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth has come up with a new test called the SCAT.
The test is under an hour long. Each section is approximately 30 min. For test prep, please come 30 min. prior to your session to test.

http://cty.jhu.edu/ts/grades26.html

http://cty.jhu.edu/ts/grades78.html

http://www.ssat.org/ssat/info/home.html
Lower Level (Grades 5-7)
Upper Level (Grades 8-11)
Section # of Items Time
Quantitive Reasoning 2 sections
25 multiple choice each
30 min. each
Verbal Reasoning 60 multiple choice 30 min.
Reading Comprehension 40 multiple choice 40 min.
Writing 1 essay 25 min.

Total Time: 2 hr. 5 min.

ISEE

http://erblearn.org/parents/admission/isee
Lower Level (Grades 5 & 6)
Section # of Items Time
Verbal Reasoning 34 items 20 min.
Quantitative Reasoning 38 items 40 min.
Reading Comprehension 25 items 20 min.
Mathematics Achievement 30 items 30 min.

Total Time: 2 hr. 20 min.

Middle Level (Grades 7 & 8)

Section # of Items Time
Verbal Reasoning 40 items 20 min.
Quantitative Reasoning 37 items 35 min.
Reading Comprehension 36 items 35 min.
Mathematics Achievement 47 items 40 min.
Writing 1 essay 30 min.

Total Time: 2 hr. 40 min.

Upper Level (Grades 9-12)

Section # of Items Time
Verbal Reasoning 40 items 20 min.
Quantitative Reasoning 37 items 35 min.
Reading Comprehension 36 items 35 min.
Mathematics Achievement 47 items 40 min.
Writing 1 essay 30 min.

Total Time: 2 hr. 40 min.

ERB

http://erblearn.org/
For test prep, please come 30 min. prior to session.

CATHOLIC HIGH SCHOOL ENTRANCE EXAMS

Most Catholic High School Entrance Exams are particular to the school, and the schools usually do not release the exams; however, most Catholic school entrance exams draw from a standard format. Because we have been in the area for 15+ years and have tutored numerous students who take the test each year, we use their feedback to put together a similar practice test format.
Please come 30 min. prior to your session.
Some of the Catholic Schools in our area:
http://www.delbarton.org/admissions/index.aspx
http://www.shp.org/podium/default.aspx?t=115214
http://www.academyofsaintelizabeth.org/admissions.html
http://www.villawalsh.org/s/172/villawalsh.aspx?sid=172&gid=1&pgid=867

NJ ASK

http://www.nj.gov/education/assessment/es/
For test prep, please come 30 min. prior to session.

GEPA

http://www.nj.gov/education/assessment/ms/
For test prep, please come 30 min. prior to session.

HSPA

http://www.nj.gov/education/assessment/hs/
For test prep, depending on your needs, please come 30-60 min. prior to session.

GRE

http://www.ets.org/gre/
Section # of Items Time
Analytical Writing 1 issue task
1 argument task		 45 min.
30 min.
Verbal 30 multiple choice 30 min.
Quantitative 28 multiple choice 45 min.

Total Time: 2 hr. 25 min.

GMAT

http://www.mba.com/the-gmat.aspx
Section # of Items Time
Analytical Writing Assessment 2 essays 1 hr.
Verbal 30-35 multiple choice 1 hr. 15 min.
Quantitative 35-40 multiple choice 75 min.

Total Time: 3 hr. 25 min.

LSAT

http://www.lsac.org/JD/LSAT/about-the-LSAT.asp
Section # of Items Time
Reading Comprehension ≈25 multiple choice 35 min.
Logical Reasoning ≈25 multiple choice 35 min.
Analytical Reasoning 2 sections: ≈60 multiple choice each 35 min.
Writing Sample 1 essay 35 min.

Total Time: 2 hr. 55 min.

MCAT

https://www.aamc.org/students/applying/mcat/
Section # of Items Time
Verbal Reasoning 60 multiple choice 1 hr. 25 min.
Physical Sciences 77 multiple choice 1 hr. 40 min.
Writing Sample 2 essays 1 hr.
Biological Sciences 77 multiple choice 1 hr. 40 min.

Total Time: 5 hr. 45 min.



Academic Subjects
  • MATH
    Geometry, Algebra 1, Algebra 2, Algebra 3, Trigonometry, Math Analysis, Pre-Calculus, Calculus, Statistics, Linear Algebra, Multi-Variable Calculus
  • SCIENCE
    Earth Science, Environmental Science, Biology, Chemistry, Physics
  • HISTORY
    World History, US History, European History, Human Geography, US Government and Politics, Comparative Politics, International Affairs
  • ENGLISH
    Essays, Reading Analysis, Creative Writing
  • OTHER
    College Applications, Interview Skills, Study Skills, Organization Strategy

Testing Room Our Center is fully equipped with all of the practice tests listed on this page. Students will take the section(s) that they would like to prep for the day and enter into our testing room which is fully equipped with Scantrons, pencils, calculators, and candy.

Extra Time

If you have extra time, please use the time estimates on this page as a guideline and then add on your extra time allotment. You are responsible for coming in earlier, as per your allotment.





New Procedure Regarding Academic Sessions

Upload materials to your account prior to your session.
LOG IN --- MY DOCUMENTS (upper right hand corner)
*You may upload a cell phone pic of the material.

If you do not have an electronic copy or cell phone pic:
1) send your tutor an email with as much information on what topic you are covering/what your assignment is.
2) when you arrive for your session, please provide the front desk with the material and they can scan it in for you.

(This procedure has been put in place to have our academic sessions be more efficient and effective.)
